title: Letterhead, "Aluminum Company of America, Detroit", late 20th century
medium: Letterpress: silver ink on off white wove paper
inscribed: Imprinted in silver embossing, below Company name (Aluminum company of America), upper center (small point size): 3311 DUNN ROAD/(in smaller 'Cloister Black' type): Detroit 11, Mich.  Imprinted at upper left: 439.
description: Heraldic shield logo of ALCOA (imprinted in embossed silver) is at upper left.   Beneath the name "ALCOA", the shield has a circular medallion containing a cross with the words 'ALUMINIUM ' (imprinted horizontally) and 'ALCOA' (imprinted vertically), with a star in the spaces between the extensions of the cross.  Company name (Aluminum company of America) in 'Cloister Black' type and address printed at top of sheet.

tombstone.epitaph: Letterhead, "Aluminum Company of America, Detroit", late 20th century. Letterpress: silver ink on off white wove paper. Gift of Thomas F. O'Malley. 1998-64-10.
